title: Over Rs800bn Balochistan budget to be presented on June 22
text: quetta balochistan finance mi nister mir shoaib ahmed nosher wani present rs billion budget next financial year provincial assembly june officials disclosed saturday officials finance department said balochistan would receive rs bn share nfc award federal government year province given rs bn nfc award current financial year according sources province would receive rs bn account oil gas royalties financial year presiding consultative meeting coalition partners opposition members connection budget preparation chief minister mir sarfraz ahmed bugti discussed government priority finalise budget consensus balochistan governor jaffar khan mandokhail provincial assembly speaker abdul khaliq achakzai also attended meeting first time province coalition partners well opposition members consulted budget proposals officials said coalition parties opposition members reposed confidence chief minister endorsing budget formulation reforms governance particip nts meeting also expressed satisfaction budget proposals said decided principle maintain volume development projects ensuring timely implementation without delay health education priorities upcoming budget proposal increase education budget per cent health budget pc cm bugti told participants meeting mentioned ensure timely implementation developmental projects tendering process would commence first month upcoming fiscal year immediately eid said responsible officers would tasked overseeing field operations developmental projects enh ance accountability said efforts progress make anti corruption establishment effective cm inspection team active improved governance published dawn june th

title: Business leaders ask govt to revisit harsh budgetary measures
text: karachi appreciating prime minister shehbaz sharif decision cut electricity rate rs per unit industrial sector trade industry leaders continued criticise budgetary measures announced fiscal year federation pakistan chambers commerce industry fpcci president atif ikram sheikh acknowledged government efforts formulating comprehensive budget challenging economic conditions however said specific provisions finance bill may negatively impact exporters letter pm fpcci chief said shift fixed one per cent withholding income tax standard tax regime exporters introduces complexities may deter especially small medium enterprises smes due increased bureaucratic engagements federal board revenue proposed withdrawal sales tax exemptions local supplies registered exporters could destabilise supply chain introduction severe non bailable penalties suspected tax fraud raises concerns potential misuse leading unwarranted harassment deterring investment said say meagre tariff cut enough economic revival karachi chamber commerce industry kcci president iftikhar ahmed sheikh said power tariff cut would least provide smes breathing space survival demanded gas prices brought regionally competitive levels prime minister promised help bring cost business cost manufacturing international level however drew prime minister attention k electric pc increase fixed charges rs rs requires government immediate intervention otherwise tariff cut relief would fade away korangi association trade industry kati johar qandhari said lower tariff would significantly relieve industrialists exporters however expressed concerns rs hike electricity rates nepra diminishes overall benefit rs per unit highlighted government initial reduction estimated provide rs bn relief industrial sector subsequent nepra adjustment halved benefit urged government implement comprehensive measures genuinely reduce production costs enhancing competitiveness pakistani products global markets kcci president iftikhar ahmed sheikh said budget appears prepared using standard imf template disappointing business community working classes pakistan obviously limited fiscal space debt obligations left little room finance ministry fbr come significant relief trade industry particular public general said tax rate salaried individuals remains capped pc whereas non salaried individuals non corporate sector smes aops see increase pc pc introduces horizontal inequity places disproportionate tax burden non salaried individuals compared salaried counterparts kcci chief added said increase fed rs per kg rs per kg cement likely impact growth construction industry negatively may lead higher construction costs affecting commercial residential development elevating general sales tax pc pc tier retailers textile leather sectors could exacerbate miseries struggling industry particularly textile sector already seen contraction pc could lead decline domestic demand reduce profitability garment leather industries feared mr iftikhar urged government revisit budgetary measures announced finance bill remove anomalies certain harsh measures likely negatively impact business environment exports gdp growth published dawn june th

title: Formula milk industry urges govt to impose 18pc GST in phases
text: karachi rs per litre hike price loose milk cost locally produced infant formula fortified nut rition milk also exp ected rise following imposition per cent general sales tax gst budget speech wednesday finance min ister muhammad aur ngzeb proposed commodity removed list zero rated products taxed meanwhile industry representatives exp r essed apprehension standard pc tax status severe implications businesses cause significant damage waqar ahmed sheikh industry representative said locally produced infant formula children fortified nutrition milk different prices estimated price one litre container tetra pack milk would rise rs rs imposition gst impact pc taxes mr sheikh explained pc sales tax charged products pc new advance income tax would applicable retailers registered fed eral board revenue fbr since pc traders registered unwilling comply fbr guidelines customers bear cost sudden tax approximately pc would greatly impact businesses ann ual turnover profitability leading scale operations added local manufacturers requested federal government phase gst imposition three stages starting pc first year followed pc second year remaining pc third year mr sheikh added pakistan facing crisis malnutrition five mortality rate every births high international standards according national nutrition survey pc children pakistan underweight half children affected stunting claimed mr sheikh added also highlighted issue meeting senate standing committee finance revenue currently deliberating budget proposals senator saleem mandviwalla committee chairman suggested fbr head also present meeting review imposition pc gst said gst locally produced infant nutrition children fortified milk implemented gradually phased approach gst balance impact industry consumers generating revenue government emphasised importance low gst supporting child nutrition milk address issue malnutrition published dawn june th

title: Travel ban on non-filers to apply only after due notice, FBR chief tells Senate body
text: islamabad federal board revenue fbr chairman amjad zubair tiwana saturday clarified immediate travel restrictions non filers proposed federal budget presented government next fiscal year june stating prior notice inclusion income general tax order would pre requisite action clarification given fbr chairman senate standing committee finance revenue presided senator saleem mandviwala pakistan peoples party ppp according official handout issued senate secretariat fifth session committee meeting meticulously scrutinise provisions income tax ordinance outlined clause finance bill fbr chairman clarified requirement link ntn national tax number passports international travel would apply due notice inclusion income tax general order dispelling public concerns regarding immediate travel restrictions may mentioned announcing federal budget government proposed series measures punish individuals businesses file income tax returns including possibility barred foreign travel measures appeared another attempt government coerce non filers filing tax returns documentation economy speech floor national assembly june finance minister muhammad aurangzeb said government aimed increase tax base widen tax gdp ratio measures finance bill proposed amendments section b income tax ordinance stop non filers travelling abroad sub clause said section already empowered fbr disable mobile phone sims cut electricity gas connections non filers citizen pakistan liable file tax returns stopped travelling abroad proposal passed parliament implementing agencies slapped penalty rs defy orders take three punitive actions penalty go rs every subsequent defiance committee members also apprised introduction new category termed late filer income tax ordinance targeting individuals sporadically file returns without consistent adherence committee underscored need impose stricter penalties proposing per cent tax levy withdrawal previous concessions furthermore committee members also deliberated advertising expenses related brand royalties expressing reservations proposed clauses affecting local investors ownership control thresholds response queries regarding income tax imports committee members expressed astonishment proposed methods determining minimum taxable values advocating customs evaluations standard practice committee gave reservations deferred amendments review alongside sales tax amendments similarly proposals regarding property tax extensions ex fata ex pata postponed pending reconsideration committee also addressed concerns regarding per cent gst general sales tax levies packaging items locally processed milk products advocating reductions alleviate consumer burdens particularly essential items infant formula notable exchange ppp senator sherry rehman emphasised equitable tax distribution among corporations advocating shifting tax burdens onto consumers products like formula milk committee meeting attended sherry rehman mohsin aziz anusha rahman ahmad khan shahzab durrani farooq naek shibli faraz munzoor ahmed kakar published dawn june th

title: Rice exporters reject hybrid taxation
text: karachi chief rice exporters association pakistan reap criticised government budget proposal convert export trade final tax regime ftr hybrid model national tax regime ntr minimum tax regime mtr combination would prove disastrous export business government seems pleading international institutions lend foreign exchange time pushing export sector brink closure chela ram kewlani told press conference karachi press club kpc saturday government proposed shift one per cent turnover based ftr standard taxation per cent taxable profit also suggested ntr plus pc super tax minimum one per cent paid pc tax profit exporters would create disastrous impact export trade said regrettable fbr empowered audit exporters books accounts assess profits losses would encourage corruption harassment mr kewlani said published dawn june th

title: LCCI asks govt to cut expenditures
text: lahore lahore chamber commerce industry lcci saturday said laws made tax net rather already paying taxes emphasising need expanding tax base lcci president kashif anwar pointed organisation always supported efforts broadening tax net however stressed government must reduce expenditures government must review agreements made ipps bring sectors including agriculture tax net said mr anwar speaking post budget seminar also suggested facilities provided public representatives assemblies discontinued lcci chief stated imposition taxes exporters opposed changing decades old tax regime exports overnight mentioned previously exporters subjected per cent final tax turnover included normal tax regime affecting exports published dawn june th

title: Analysis: Ignoring inflation won’t make it go away
text: one notable claims made budget presentation process government claim keep inflation pc coming fiscal year face seems rooted many planned actions aim keep rate inflation low aggressive tax measures form major part revenue measures outlined seem designed opposite e drive prices may different methodologies measure inflation fact remains anything higher pc average monthly inflation rate outgoing fiscal year result higher prices consumers dr abid suleri executive director sustainable development policy institute sdpi believes government adjusted minimum taxable income account inflation setting personal income tax slabs govt claims keep inflation pc coming fiscal year aggressive taxation regime seeks put place makes seem like unachievable target current exemption rs per month little doubling tax falling first tax slab reduce disposable income exacerbating economic hardships says furthermore rising fuel costs due increased levies higher gst rates specific sectors expected drive inflation impacting cost living mention taxing agricultural income could broadened tax base considerably adds pc post budget presser fina nce secretary imdadullah bosal said inflation projected hover around pc explain would singular explanation mr bosal provided keeping policy rate high would effectively manage demands control inflation dawn reached finance ministry clarification secretary opinion receive response high base fy noted economist dr ashfaq h khan thinks inflation rate may remain low preclude price hikes rate inflation slowing due downward trend international commodity prices near static policy rate incidentally variables contribute inflation pakistan usually driven supply side issues shortages rather rising demand consumer price index cpi basket made items items predominantly perishable food products particularly volatile terms price fluctuation due variety factors primarily services non perishable products see little change prices course year aggressive nature taxation measures announced budget affect baskets central bank approach keeping interest rate high level deliver goods since recent deceleration inflation due series supply side improvements notably lower prices wheat flour fuel high interest rate already increased cost business entrepreneurs reduced capital supply industry basket goods appraisal budget reveals around items affected newly proposed tax measures directly indirectly turn impact perishable half cpi basket food beverages make approximately pc cpi seasonal factors also contribute fluctuations input costs closely tied changes fuel prices incidentally government announced flat increase rs per litre price petrol diesel next fiscal year form levy addition rise international prices also possibility gst petroleum products may reintroduced additionally fluctuations fuel prices directly impact transportation index cpi carries weightage approximately six per cent cpi basket earlier following suspension food imports india afghanistan iran become significant suppliers vegetables fruits make shortages domestic market retail prices however remained high due expensive transportation counter government eliminated sales tax imported food products also implemented measures facilitate import time around government withdrawn concessionary measures imposed pc sales tax vegetables fruits afghanistan estimates duty free imports deprived rs billion potential revenue cost imported vegetables fruits rises throughout next fiscal year food inflation soar non perishable side government imposed pc gst healthcare sector ranging raw materials diagnoses import health equipment supplies hospitals federal board revenue fbr expects raise rs bn measures cost passed consumers higher treatment costs medicine prices healthcare sector reference accounts pc total cpi meanwhile removal exemptions exercise books pens ball pens markers pencils inks colour sets geometry boxes items used education sector affect head accounts around pc total cpi weightage stationery price rises also affect offices indirect taxes overall increase sales tax pc fy however imposition indirect taxes customs excise duties withholding tax also definitely add inflation withholding tax wht revenue continues leading source direct tax receipts fbr owing easier mode collection economic agents failure tax authorities tap large undocumented segments economy pc called direct tax revenue comes wht reports many businesses treat withholding taxes expense pass burden consumers ample proof withholding agents depositing actual amount deducted source taxpayers many cases recently detected tax authorities take economist realise higher fuel prices increased costs education healthcare indirect taxes supply chains result costs going across board perhaps would prudent financial planners told us rather trying sugarcoat published dawn june th

title: CM Murad defends budget allocation for old development schemes
text: murad ali shah accepts govt failure achieve growth target says govt try achieve difficult growth target cm addd sindh govt focus completing old schemes sindh chief minister murad ali shah saturday blamed caretaker government delay implementation province development schemes stressing administration focus completing old projects initiatives using budget speaking post budget presser karachi today cm murad lamented delay development schemes due caretaker government decision shut budget furthermore accepting province failed achieve growth target chief minister said government would try achieve growth target next fiscal year although seems difficult budget made difficult circumstances said adding current revenue expenditure goes towards salaries remarks come provincial government rs trillion budget allocated total outlay amounting rs billion development according news rs billion go provincial annual development plan adp addition regular adp sindh government development portfolio public private partnership mode stands rs billion whereby projects rs billion already executed projects worth rs billion currently different stages construction alongside worth rs billion bidding stage new scheme included next financial year publication added issue revenue generation cm said sindh revenue board target next fiscal year rs billion question alleging work done sindh without corruption commission shah said problems everywhere people province agree elected us polls said speaking issue water security chief minister said federal government allocated less budget connecting keenjhar lake k iv project federal government allocated rs billion k iv project whereas sindh government spend rs billion said adding prime minister shehbaz sharif promised disbursement concerned amount approved june

title: Check New Car Prices in Pakistan after revised Withholding Tax
text: islamabad federal government decided collect advance income tax based price vehicles rather engine capacity purchase registration vehicles pakistan finance minister introduced proposal budget currently taxes calculated based engine capacity vehicles cc yesterday national assembly received muhammad aurangzeb budget proposal withholding tax cars based ex factory price rather engine capacity following prices cars ranging cc cc upto cc cars cc cars

title: Tax relief proposed for salaried individuals in Pakistan
text: karachi pakistani federal government presented maiden budget focus securing substantial imf bailout aggressive taxation budget targets nearly percent surge income tax revenue pc increase general sales tax collection amid concerns inflation senate standing committee finance proposed reduced tax rate salaried individuals committee also approved tax non filers phone internet services rejected pc capital gains tax property transactions sharing parliamentarians records nadra tax collection senator saleem mandviwalla called equal taxes late filers non filers members advocated eae towards filers stricter taxation non filers committee postponed proposal increase property tax rejected extending tax exemptions fata pata fbr chairman highlighted high withholding tax rate non filers mentioning possible disconnection mobile sims business operations next fiscal year sales tax imposed processed food items zero rating abolished committee also approved ban foreign travel non filers exemptions certain categories non filers face disconnection mobile sims electricity gas connections fbr chairman reiterated non filers face high withholding tax rates potential disconnection mobile sims business operations including temporarily becoming filers

title: Pakistani retailers must accept Credit Card Payments or face music, FBR Chairman warns
text: islamabad government pushing retailers accept credit card payments digital trail aiding tax collection efforts reducing tax evasion senate standing committee finance stressed enforcing regulations related credit card payments chairman federal board revenue fbr assured strict measures would taken ensure retailers accept payments credit cards non compliant businesses facing closure senator sherry rehman expressed concerns retailers using technical issues excuses accepting credit cards urged prompt action address problems committee stated three complaints per day five per week consumers would lead regulatory action non compliant businesses latest directions businesses failing issue least three receipts per day five receipts per week via point sale pos systems face penalties half million fbr chairman also announced implementation new monitoring dashboard track operational status pos machines shops aiming enhance oversight accountability

title: Budget 2024-25: Sindh proposes new taxes on imported and locally made cars
text: karachi sindh chief minister murad ali shah announced budget rs trillion fiscal year marking increase government also announced new taxes rationalizing existing tax structures provincial government country southeastern region proposed new tax structure vehicles based origin engine capacity imported vehicles engine capacity cc cc tax amount rs imported motor cars jeeps falling within engine capacity range taxed rs lac engine capacity cc cc tax amount rs imported motor cars jeeps within engine capacity range incur tax rs lac thousands engine capacity cc tax amount rs imported motor cars jeeps engine capacity cc taxed rs lac thousand locally manufactured assembled vehicles engine capacity cc cc tax amount rs cars jeeps engine capacity range taxed rs

title: Budget has disappointed people, business community: Mian Zahid
text: karachi chairman national business group pakistan president pakistan businessmen intellectuals forum mian zahid hussain said federal budget inconsistent recent announcements economic managers prime minister promises public expectations said budget would harm people disappointed business community needs made clear whether government wants economic development whether priority economic stability hussain said burden taxpayers increased billion rupees tantamount encouraging tax evaders tax defaulters targeted budget unfortunate revenue target greatly increased neither reduction government expenditures concessions trillion withdrawn deficit estimated rs billion said nothing done budget collect tax non paying sectors instead collecting tax directly retailers decided collect withholding tax manufacturers hit well masses hard increase inflation various types penalties announced pay taxes effective plan digitising economy announced mian zahid hussain said last five years income salaried class continuously decreasing tax increased increase problems budget instead reducing cost business exporters taxes increased left mercy fbr similarly export facilitation scheme eliminated local supply reduce exports cruel eighteen per cent sales tax imposed hundreds health sector items government commitment economic reforms appear claimed nothing done increase tax base reliance placed sources revenue growth fuel inflation problems industrial agricultural sectors also increase due budget investment environment affected concluded copyright business recorder

text: islamabad federal board revenue fbr chief apprised senate standing committee finance revenue electricity gas connections non filers would suspended part government efforts broaden tax net besides fbr chairman zubair tiwana also informed senate panel saturday shutting non filers businesses also cards federal government seeks enhance tax gdp ratio latest development senate standing committee finance revenue saturday okayed proposal impose foreign travel ban non filers series decisions made today session senate body held chair saleem mandviwalla fbr chairman zubair tiwana informed upper house body failed file tax returns would face actions income tax general order itgo however exemptions would given nationals hajj umrah children students holders national identity card overseas pakistanis nicop detailed non filers face suspension sim cards electricity gas connections well businesses could shut session pakistan peoples party ppp senator farooq h naek stressed travel restrictions non filers executed way enforced came category exit control list ecl tiwana said higher withholding tax rate approved non filers added non filer list included people million annual income added listed individuals already disclosed income statements tax return documents past fbr top officer said temporary filers also pay additional tax purchases vehicles plots residences additionally senate body also approved proposal reduce salary slab hike tax besides approving imposition withholding tax cellular internet bills non filers earlier week finance minister muhammad aurangzeb emphasised need widening tax net saying country run tax gdp ratio bring everyone tax net aiming bring everyone active taxpayers list said finance czar speaking geo news programme aaj shahzeb khanzada kay sath wednesday abolish non filer category country added statement comes hours unveiled federal budget fiscal year national assembly total outlay rs trillion

title: Pakistan’s telecom sector raises concerns over heavy taxes
text: pakistan telecom operators association expressed concerns heavy taxes slapped budget ary news reported letter written chairman standing committee finance salim mandviwala telecom operators expressed concerns heavy taxes introduced budget telecom sector warned foreign investment might withdraw pakistan tax issues resolved according telecom operators unresolved tax issues could lead legal complications government letter highlights two major market players already decided leave pakistan telecom sector contributed pkr billion tax revenue last year attracted direct investment usd billion date letter stated implementation budget proposals severely impact dream digital pakistan letter content reveals letter mentions collecting advance tax non filer telecom users impractical letter outlines decision result revenue loss telecom sector government additionally telecom companies expressed concerns income tax general order read non filers pay additional taxes mobile top bundles regarding issue blocking sim cards non filers telecom sector considered penalties telecom sector party tax issue concerning non filers according letter increasing sales tax rate mobile phone sets valued usd negatively impact inclusion low income group letter mentions telecom operators requested time meeting committee chairman saleem mandviwalla present concerns

title: FBR forms committees to identify, resolve Finance Bill 2024 anomalies
text: islamabad federal board revenue fbr chairman malik amjed zubair tiwana saturday formed two anomaly committees order identify remove business technical related anomalies finance bill anomaly committee business chaired president federation pakistan chambers commerce industry fpcci atif akram shaikh pakistan textile mills association aptma gohar ijaz co chairpersons member customs policy ashhad jawad member ir policy amna faiz bhatty said news release similarly anomaly committee technical chaired managing partner kpmg adnan rizvi member customs policy ashhad jawad member ir policy amna faiz bhatty co chairpersons members committees include prominent businessmen various chambers commerce trade bodies committees consituted fbr submit recommendations june read finance minister aurangzeb unveils budget total outlay rs tr earlier june finance minister muhammad aurangzeb presented federal budget total outlay rs trillion pakistan budget upcoming year aims modest per cent gdp growth sets ambitious rs tr tax collection target raising taxes salaried classes removing tax exemptions rest aurangzeb budget presentation said goal widen tax base avoid burdening existing tax payers year budget like last year widely considered crafted align international monetary fund imf requirements secure another bailout time larger longer

title: 18pc GST to be imposed on all packaged food items: FBR chief
text: karachi federal board revenue fbr imposed percent general sales tax gst packaged food items including formula milk ary news reported decision announced meeting senate standing committee finance chaired senator saleem mandviwalla chairman fbr amjad zubair told committee gst apply packaged items including departmental stores large retail outlets unpacked food items sold general stores committee recommended reduction gst formula milk considering importance infant health chairman fbr informed committee tax revenue formula milk significant government willing consider reduction tax rates companies reduce prices read imf wants pakistan increase gst pc committee also discussed issue unregistered outlets selling formula milk recommended outlets blacklisted pertinent mention international monetary fund imf mission earlier asked pakistani authorities increase general sales tax gst per cent demand put forward imf four round talks pakistan authorities fresh loan imf mission observed pakistan sales tax collection system facing problems centre collecting sales tax commodities provinces services suggested sales tax collection done federal government international lender also demanded end gst exemption increase per cent commodities service sources said

title: PM Shehbaz hopes upcoming IMF programme will be last
text: islamabad prime minister pm shehbaz sharif vowed take strict actions achieve country economic targets promising would last loan programme international monetary fund imf address nation pm shehbaz expressed satisfaction revenue collection current fiscal year saying collection increased percent compared last year prime minister said new revenue collection targets set next financial year saying achieving targets seem challenging assured federal government make efforts collect taxes eliminate corrupt practices pm shehbaz said foreign official visits sought investment opportunities pakistan rather asking loans prime minister assured government facilitate investments special investment facilitation council focusing agriculture energy sectors praised overseas pakistanis sending usd billion remittances last month terming confidence government policies regarding long term economic plans pm shehbaz said pakistan begun implementing economic agenda next five years committed maintaining success economic strategies pm shehbaz said private sector would encouraged establish new industrial units tough decisions taken pm shehbaz also announced taking difficult decisions brighten future pakistan government tolerate pressure ready make sacrifice country added coming days people see major changes going happen struggle started elite prime minister said hoping nation would support economic revival agenda prime minister also spelled five year agenda economics stability defined future course action pursue utmost honesty strictness spend every saved penny public welfare eliminate red tapism journey difficult long also demands sacrifice government authorities well elite pm shehbaz said address day performance prime minister said pakistan achieved several milestones since government came power including reducing inflation percent percent reducing interest rates loans percent percent increasing investment country providing relief public reducing petrol prices rs per litre one measures taken government prime minister added pm shehbaz said reduction petroleum prices would surely benefit common man reducing prices petrol diesel provide relief people suffering inflation prime minister said said performance past three months commendable committed putting country path progress added extended felicitation pakistani nation muslim ummah auspicious occasion hajj eid ul adha atrocities iojk gaza condemned prime minister also condemned ongoing israeli aggression gaza describing unprecedented human history also expressed sorrow loss thousands innocent lives including children prayed freedom illegally occupied jammu kashmir palestine
